Comments_List: This process feels like it's spilling right out into the rest of my life, which is great and the most I could have asked for. A highlight of my time at Yale. Specifically, skills about collaboration and painting

Writing a thesis was much harder than I expected; I was excited build off the skills I learned + things I read in some of my other classes, but crafting an argument out of my interests, outside of the constant discussion/throwing-around of ideas that happens in classrooms, was quite difficult. Learning how to do all of that was an invaluable experience.
The strength is the freedom afforded students. I lucked out with interested, engaged, caring advisors.

A small thing, but I wish we'd been informed of the due date for the prospectus a month or two earlier in junior year--I wish I'd had the senior essay on my mind for longer before submitting a prospectus and finding an advisor.
